events.event_description: U.S. oil refining capacity reached 18.4 million barrels per day, with Canadian crude oil imports making up 60% of total U.S. imports.
events.citation: U.S. oil refining capacity stood at 18.4 million barrels per day (b/d) as of January 1, 2024. In 2023, 60% of U.S. crude oil imports originated in Canada, up from 33% in 2013.

events.event_description: Canada's crude oil production reached 4.6 million barrels per day, nearly triple its refinery capacity of 1.7 million barrels per day.
events.citation: Crude oil production averaged 4.6 million b/d in Canada during 2023, nearly three times the country's 1.7 million-b/d refinery capacity.

events.event_description: The Express Pipeline's capacity was expanded from 287,000 b/d to 310,000 b/d to increase oil sands exports from Western Canada to U.S. Rockies region refineries.
events.citation: In 2020, the Express Pipeline's capacity was expanded from 287,000 b/d to 310,000 b/d, allowing producers to increase oil sands exports from Western Canada to U.S. Rockies region refineries.

events.event_description: The Trans Mountain Expansion Project (TMX) became operational, tripling pipeline capacity to Canada's Pacific Coast to 890,000 b/d.
events.citation: In May 2024, the Trans Mountain Expansion Project (TMX) became operational, nearly tripling the pipeline capacity to Canada's Pacific Coast to 890,000 b/d.
